p:
Here,
d e
and
d i
are the distances from the Hirshfeld surface to the nearest atom outside (external) and inside (internal) the surface, correspondingly. The color of the Hirshfeld surface changes from red (showing the distances shorter than the sum of vdW radii) through white (distances are equal to the sum of vdW radii) to blue (distances are longer than the sum of vdW radii). The fraction of the corresponding atomic contacts is also given in percent.
